feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 13 at 1:46PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water Levels Expected This Week... Heavy rain is occuring over the northeast Brooks Range east of the Dalton Highway. Rainfall totals from 1 to 1.5 inches are possible between Monday evening and Wednesday. Runoff from this rainfall and melting of the remaining snowpack will cause rivers draining the northeast Brooks Range to rise to bankfull levels in
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast; Northeastern Brooks Range

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 13 at 1:40PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water On The Koyukuk River This Week... Runoff from heavy rain in the Brooks Range late last week is moving down the Koyukuk River. The crest of high water is expected to reach Huslia from Wednesday into Thursday. This high water will cause erosion of the Koyukuk River bank at Huslia. Residents should prepare for significant erosion of the riverbank and high
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys

entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued June 13 at 11:08AM AKDT until June 15 at 4:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 4 AM AKDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...High Surf expected. Strong southwesterly winds with gusts to 40 mph will create heavy wave action and will push the water levels 2 to 3 feet above the normal high tide line. * WHERE...Southern Seward Peninsula Coast.

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued June 13 at 9:15AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...OZONE HIGH POLLUTION ADVISORY FOR MARICOPA COUNTY INCLUDING THE PHOENIX METRO AREA THROUGH WEDNESDAY... The Arizona Department of Environmental Quality (ADEQ) has issued an Ozone High Pollution Advisory for the Phoenix Metro Area through Wednesday. This means that forecast weather conditions combined with existing ozone levels are expected to result in local maximum 8-hour ozone

entry.title: Fire Weather Watch issued June 13 at 2:50PM CDT until June 15 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...CRITICAL FIRE CONDITIONS EXPECTED THURSDAY FOR SOUTHWEST NEW MEXICO AND FAR WEST TEXAS... .Winds will increase on Thursday afternoon with an upper level system across the far Southwest. Min RH values will between 6 and 14% combine with 20 foot winds between 20 and 25 mph along with ERC values in the 85-95th percentile to create low-end red flag

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued June 13 at 8:18AM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: .Several days of heavy rainfall in western Hot Springs County has caused flows to increase on Owl Creek. Additionally, releases from Anchor Dam will be increased today to mitigate concerns in that area. Flows in Owl Creek are expected to be bankfull and higher to cause minor flooding concerns from Anchor Dam down to the Bighorn River.
